Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: துப்புர வில்லார் துவரத் துறவாமைஉப்பிற்கும் காடிக்கும் கூற்று.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The destitute poor, who do not renounce their bodies, only consume their neighbour's salt and water.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A destitute person is shown who has not fully renounced the world ('துவரத் துறவாமை'). They are still attached to their life.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Because they are destitute and have not renounced, they are forced to go to their neighbor's house to live.
Layered_Composition.Background: Their existence is depicted as a purely consumptive one. They are personified as a spectral figure of Death ('கூற்று') for their neighbor's simple possessions. They are shown consuming the neighbor's salt ('உப்பு') and sour gruel ('காடி'), contributing nothing and only acting as a drain on the neighbor's meager resources.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The destitute who do not fully renounce worldly life become a 'death' to the simple salt and gruel of those who have to support them.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The destitute person as a 'Yama/Death' figure for the neighbor's food is a harsh but powerful metaphor. It frames their dependent existence as a destructive, consuming force on the lives of others.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A bleak, grey, and impoverished light. The spectral 'death' quality of the destitute person can be a shadowy, life-draining aura. The neighbor is shown looking on with a sense of weary resignation.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A scene inside the neighbor's humble kitchen, showing the 'death-like' destitute person consuming the last of the salt and gruel.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with a focus on the bleakness of the situation.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Social realism, with a symbolic, dark fantasy element.

Cultural_Anchors: The non-renouncing destitute (துப்புர வில்லார் துவரத் துறவாமை)
